message: I use iMapMyRide, iMapMyWalk and iMapMyFitness all have GPS and linked website tracking.
I haven't had much chance to ride of late, but when I do, I usually use cyclemeter. It's got the GPS stuff & supports multi-tasking, so doesn't cut out when you change song
RunMeter, it doesn't have web UI, but so far, it's the only one that pause the iPod before the audio cues kick in. I listen to audiobooks while running.
Runkeeping is awesome for me. I do a lot of running and bike riding so the gps is great
@chrisonhismac You mean RunKeeper, yes?  I use it too.  Great tracking app for anyone that walks/runs/bikes for exercise.  Nice app on the phone with beautiful integration with the Web site.

@FCGreg I'll have to try RunKeeper. Looks pretty cool.  Does anyone actually the monthly fee for live tracking.  Thats really the only reason I started using iMapMyWalk. But Live tracking is not something I really care about.
